Server¶

The Flask code is split into four files:

  1. server.py – Entry point for the Flask app, handles serving the static files
  2. backend.py – Foundation for the backend endpoints
  3. data.py – Handles the fetching of data from external sources, and processing them
  4. student.py – Functions called by student endpoints
  5. faculty.py – Functions called by faculty endpoints

Server Entry Point¶

The server.py file serves the static pages, and expects Vue (on the static pages) to poll the backend for information.

server.index()[source]¶

Serves the welcome page

server.facultyIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the faculty portal

server.studentIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the student portal

server.helpIndex(path)[source]¶

Serves the Sphinx documentation

server.add_header(r)[source]¶

Add headers to force the browser to not cache static files. To make it easier for development, can be safely removed in production.

Backend¶

The backend.py file prepares the data needed and exposes the data to the frontend via REST endpoints.

backend.callFetchData()[source]¶

Endpoint to start fetching data

Called when server is started, or when the Refresh data button is pressed in Faculty side.

backend.fetchDataStatus()[source]¶

Fetches the current status of data fetching (as an integer from 0 to 100)

backend.mainOverview(module_code)[source]¶

Fetches all relevant details to display on main page for a given module_code

Parameters: module_code - string

Data Downloading & Processing¶

data.fetchPrereqs(module_code)[source]¶

Fetches a list of prerequisites for a given module code. Uses nusmods’ API.

Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Prerequisities for a given module code, returns an empty list of module is not found
Return type:list
data.fetchGoogleSheet(url_num, sheet_name)[source]¶

Query data from Google spreadsheet. Data obtained from https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lWEWGZBM1sSIAHUDIcIhfo9MJQUjao3v52Qp5VRyEZM/

Parameters:
  • url_num (integer) – Representing which ‘part’ (1 or 2) the sheet belongs to
  • sheet_name (string) – Name of sheet to pull data from
Returns:

Results from Google spreadsheet
Return type:

Pandas dataframe
data.fetchFirebase(url)[source]¶

Query data from Firebase.

Parameters:url (string) – Firebase URL
Returns:Results from Firebase database
Return type:Pandas dataframe
data.fetchData()[source]¶

Fetch and process all the data that we need.

data.getScore(x)[source]¶

Maps letter grade to numeric score.

Parameters:x (string) – Letter grade
Returns:Numeric grade of a grade, nan is grade is not found (eg. S/U)
Return type:float
data.calculate_cap()[source]¶

Calculate CAP score for each student in the database after fetching module enrolment.

data.countsAsDict(df, column_name)[source]¶

Takes in a column, does a value count, and returns a dict.

Parameters:
  • df (Pandas dataframe) – Dataframe that contains the data to be counted
  • column_name (string) – Name of the column to be counted
Returns:

A dictionary with keys ‘labels’, ‘counts’, and ‘students’ with each value being a list.
Return type:

dict

Examples

>>> countsAsDict(df, column_name)
>>> {'labels': ['A', 'B'], 'counts': [2, 4], 'tokens': ['Token1', 'Token2']}
data.countsAsLists(df, column_name)[source]¶

Takes in a column, does a value count, returns as nested lists.

Parameters:
  • df (Pandas dataframe) – Dataframe that contains the data to be counted
  • column_name (string) – Name of the column to be counted
Returns:

A nested list where each sublist includes details of a label. Sublist consist of label name, count, and a list of students.
Return type:

Pandas series

Examples

>>> countsAsLists(df, column_name)
>>> [["A", 1, ['Token1', 'Token2']], ["B", 2, ['Token3']]]
data.module_all_terms(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:All module enrolments for a given module code
Return type:Pandas series
data.module_current_term(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Latest semester’s module enrolments for a given module code
Return type:Pandas series
data.module_past_terms(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Previous semesters’ module enrolments for a given module code
Return type:Pandas series
data.program_current_term(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Program enrolment for students currently taking a particular module
Return type:Pandas series
data.program_past_terms(module_code)[source]¶
Parameters:module_code (string) – module code
Returns:Program enrolment for students who previously took the module
Return type:Pandas series

Student Functions¶

Faculty Functions¶

faculty.getModuleGrades(module_code=None, program_subset=None)[source]¶

Returns grades. Can filter by module_code and/or a list of tokens

Parameters: module_code - optional string, return only grades with this module_code program_subset - optional Pandas DataFrame, return only grades belonging to those who are in this dataframe

faculty.demographics(module_code)[source]¶

Fetches all demographic data to be displayed for a given module_code.

Parameters: module_code - string
